topic.title: Using h5dump
topic.shortdesc: h5dump enables the user to examine the contents of an HDF5 file by dumping those contents, in human readable form, to the screen or to a file.

section.title: Discussion
section.p: h5dump dumps HDF5 file content to standard output. It can display the contents of the entire HDF5 file or selected objects, which can be groups, datasets, a subset of a dataset, links, attributes, or datatypes.

body.p: h5dump output can be saved to a file by directing standard output as follows, where the file being examined is sample.h5, the ASCII output file is sample_out.txt, and all of sample.h5 is to be dumped: h5dump sample.h5 > sample_out.txt

section.title: Options
section.p: h5dump offers a wide range of options, many of which can be used in combination:
